result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy J Staves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).
  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.

May not vote or hold public office.

Write letter to victim through victim witness coordinator.

$5,902.06 Restitution to be paid through the Department of Corrections.  $590.21 District Attorney's Office Surcharge for a total of $6492.27.
Restitution can be paid out of prison wages - 25% of prison wages per month go to Mr. Germanson.

CASES: 15CF132, 14CF74, 14CF432, 14CF323, 14CF75 Defendant Billy J Staves in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Billy J Staves in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2:21pm 

14CF74    Ct 1 w/o repeater- State filed motion to vacate previous plea, Def does not object. Def- plea of NC. State to file Amended Info striking repeater. 
14CF323  Ct 2 w/repeater- Def plea of NC. 
14CF432  Ct 2 w/repeater- Amended Info filed. Def plea of NC.

CT accepts pleas, finds G, enters JOCs. All other cases & Cts DRI. Also, DRI uncharged gas drive off in Barron Cty in amount of $43.07. If DRI'ed in another county and proof provided, will subtract from total. 

CT vacates DC-31 from 14CF75 that is unsigned but date stamped. CT signs DC-31 that State provides. 

SENTENCING: 
14CF74- 3 YRS 6 MOS: 1.5 IC, 2 ES consecutive to 14CF75. DNA surcharge, no sample. 
14CF323: 1 IC, 1 ES- concurrent to 14CF74 and 14CF75. 
14CF432: 1 IC, 1 ES- concurrent to 14CF323 and 14CF74 and 14CF75.

No contact with Walmart in SCF, WI or Vicki Erickson or Rick Madsen.  

no fine/cost on any. 

Atty Chapman to determine sent cred on all files. 3:30pm adj.
From Defendant to COCC re sentence credit.  Responded 4/24/15.

Defendant Billy J Staves in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Billy J Staves in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. KJB- Clerk.  11:09am 

ct 1- 4 yr 6 mos imprisonment.   2 yrs 6 mos IC, 2 ES. 
ct 2- 11 yrs imprisonment.  6 IC, 5 yrs ES
cts 3-10: 6 yrs imprisonment.   3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES

concurrent to one another, elig CI, elig for SAP, cannot possess firearms or body armor, cannot vote or hold public office, if not US Citizen- could be deported, DNA sample & surcharge, restitution to Mr. Germanson: $5, 400.99- can be paid out of prison wages. 25% of prison wages per month to go to Mr Germanson. No contact w/David Germanson, Absolute Sobriety, letter to victim through VW. 12:19pm 

Per Judge:  14CF74, 14CF432 and 14CF323 to be set for review 30 days out
from Judge GaleWyrick to DA Steffen re PSI
from DOC to Judge GaleWyrick re PSI
To Judge from Defendant - regarding counsel.
Questions from Jury - w/response from Judge MEG
Sentencing hearing on March 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.

DAY 2. Defendant Billy J Staves in court with attorney Francis X. Rivard.  Defendant Billy J Staves in custody.  David Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   KJB- Clerk. 9:25am 9:30am Jurors brought in. 10:48 Jurors released for break. Counsel gives argument for Ex #62. CT overrules objection. 10:55 break. 11:15 back on record. 12:07pm jurors released for lunch. Counsel to be back at 12:50pm. 12:20pm adj. 12:58pm back on record. 1:41pm Jurors released for break. 1:42pm CT breaks. 1:55pm back on record. CT reviews Def's right to testifiy. Def will not testify. CT finds Def's decision is FVIK made. 2:00pm Jurors brought back in. 2:10pm- State rests. Defense- no wits. 2:12pm Jurors released. Atty Rivard- Motion for dismissal of all counts due to insufficiency of evidence.  CT reserves on motion for dismissal. Ex # 1-70 O/R, sub to objections. Ex #s 200 and 202 O/R. CT accepts recovered and unrecoverd version and will be attached. 2:22pm  Back on record 4:05PM *Clerk KK* Court addresses that she will be reading jury instructions #100, #115, #157, #195, #160, #155, #148, #142, #170, #103, #145, #140, #141, #147, #150, #190, #300, #315, #200, #460, #480 and #515.  Jury enters courtroom. 4:40PM  Closing arugments by both Atty's.  Court - reads jury instructions. Alternate juror release #82.  Court goes over instruction of verdict forms.  Jury is released to deliberate.  6:48PM  Recess.  6:50PM Back on record. 8:40PM  Jury reads their verdict -

Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2- Guilty
Count 3 - Guilty
Count 4 - Guilty
Count 5 - Guilty
Count 6 - Guilty
Count 7 - Guilty
Count 8 - Guilty
Count 9 - Guilty
Count 10 - Guilty

ALL Jurors agree that this is their verdict.  

Jury is released.  8:50PM  Atty's agree to withdraw exhabit #201 (Atty Rivard was not offered)  and release to owner.  Court approves the release.  Court - Adjudge defendant convicted of counts 1-10 and enters JOC into record.  orders PSI.  Long Form.  Agent need not be present.  PSI due by NOON on 02/23/2015 - Sentencing scheduled on 03/09/2015 at 11:00AM.  Bond reinstated in 12CF75, which is $3000 cash bond.  Schedules Prelim in 14CF432.  Review set for file 14CF323.  adj.  9:04PM

Current: 507 Vine Street, Eau Claire, WI 54703   (Effective: 12-04-2014)
Prior: 710 Second Avenue, Eau Claire County Jail, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States

Defendant Billy J Staves in court with attorney Francis X. Rivard.  Defendant Billy J Staves in custody.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk 9:30 AM  2nd Amended Information filed - DA Steffen requesting recess.  9:31AM  Back on record. 9:46AM  --  Day 1 of Jury Trial  --  2nd Amended information - 10 counts.  DA Steffen addresses changes made to the 2nd Amended Information.  Defendant enters NG pleas to count 1 on 2nd Amended Information.  Before Def enters any other pleas Atty Rivard addresses count 2 - 10 and request to disallow amendment.  Court - over rules the objection and will continues with pleas to the 2nd amended information.  Defendant enters NG plea to counts 2-10.  Court - each atty will be allowed 5 strikes.  Will be seating an alternate.  Goes over counts and jury instruction.  No objection by either Attys.  Atty Rivard addresses the party to the crime charge - requesting a continuous of the matter for the fact defense/evidence with the party to the crime charge.  Court - resolve by taking out the party to the crime.  Will not reference the party to the crime charge.  Off record 10:12AM 10:22 back on record. KJB clerk. Jurors brought in. Juror Oath #1 given. 10:25 Jurors called to the box. 10:32 Voir Dire begins. #27 ex, #76 called. #38 ex, #84 called. #84 ex, #96 called. 11:58am Juror Strikes. Counsel approves Jury panel. Jury Oath #2. To be back at 1:15pm Jurors released for lunch. 12:20 break for lunch. 1:20pm back on, jurors brought in. 2:57- Court breaks, jurors released. 3:15 jurors brought in. CT- jurors to be here at 8:30am. Counsel to be here at 8am to review Jury instructions. 4:29pm adj.
and Order to Amend Information.  Submitted by DA Steffen.  Granted/Signed by Judge GaleWyrick on 11/24/2014.
Jury trial on December 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
